Interface WfwItemData

All Known Subinterfaces:
WfwItem
All Known Implementing Classes:
WfwItemDataImpl, WfwItemImpl
public interface WfwItemData
Interface providing access to Well-Formed Web Comment API (WFW) data for RSS items. This interface defines methods for accessing and setting WFW comment-related properties, including comment RSS feed URLs and comment submission endpoints.

The WFW namespace was introduced in 2003 and has become the most popular namespace for supporting comments in RSS feeds.

See Also:
  • Well-Formed Web Comment API

  • Method Details

    • getWfWItemData

      WfwItemData getWfWItemData()
      Returns the underlying WFW item data implementation.
      Returns:
      the WFW item data instance

    • getWfwCommentRss

      default Optional<String> getWfwCommentRss()
      Returns the URL of an RSS feed that contains user comments for this item. This corresponds to the wfw:commentRss element in the item.

      Note: The WFW specification indicates that some documentation has incorrectly referred to wfw:commentRSS (with uppercase RSS), though wfw:commentRss is the correct element name. Software reading feeds should accept both spellings.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the comment RSS feed URL, or an empty Optional if not present

    • setWfwCommentRss

      default void setWfwCommentRss(String wfwCommentRss)
      Sets the URL of an RSS feed that contains user comments for this item. This corresponds to the wfw:commentRss element in the item.

      An item must not contain more than one wfw:commentRss element.

      Parameters:
      wfwCommentRss - the URL of the comment RSS feed, must be a valid URL

    • getWfwComment

      default Optional<String> getWfwComment()
      Returns the URL endpoint that accepts HTTP POST requests to submit comments for this item. This corresponds to the wfw:comment element in the item.

      This endpoint is intended for use by RSS readers and other aggregators so they can offer a form to users where a comment can be entered and submitted to the publisher.

      The POST request should have a "Content-Type" header with value "text/xml" and a body containing XML resembling an RSS 2.0 feed item with optional elements: title, author, link, description, source, and the Dublin Core creator element. At minimum, either a title or description must be present.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the comment submission endpoint URL, or an empty Optional if not present

    • setWfwComment

      default void setWfwComment(String wfwComment)
      Sets the URL endpoint that accepts HTTP POST requests to submit comments for this item. This corresponds to the wfw:comment element in the item.
      Parameters:
      wfwComment - the URL endpoint for comment submission, must be a valid URL
